intro: Tithymalodes angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf tithymalodes, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and is often found in meadows or along streambanks. Its aromatic foliage and delicate blooms make it a notable species in botanical gardens and natural habitats. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its environment.
